meanings.sent1: The ageings of a person can bring wisdom and experience.
meanings.sent2: The ageings of the tree were visible in its gnarled trunk.
meanings.sent3: The ageings of the clock made it tick slower, almost as if it was tired.
meanings.sent4: The ageings of the building showed in its weathered facade, telling stories of the past.
meanings.sent5: The ageings of the book were evident in its yellowed pages and worn cover.

meanings.definition: The act of causing something to become old
meanings.sent1: The ageings of the painting were intentional to give it an antique look.
meanings.sent2: The ageings of the metal were a result of exposure to harsh weather conditions.
meanings.sent3: The ageings of the cheese were accelerated to enhance its flavor.
meanings.sent4: The ageings of the wine in the cellar added depth and complexity to its taste.
meanings.sent5: The ageings of the fabric were simulated to achieve a vintage appearance.

meanings.definition: The state of being old or mature
meanings.sent1: The ageings of the town were evident in its historic architecture.
meanings.sent2: The ageings of the wine gave it a rich and full-bodied flavor.
meanings.sent3: The ageings of the joke made it even funnier with each retelling.
meanings.sent4: The ageings of the friendship deepened the bond between the two friends.
meanings.sent5: The ageings of the oak tree made it a symbol of strength and resilience.
